Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians have accrued 219 doubles as a squad and have smacked 166 baseballs out of the park.
Cleveland owns a slugging percentage of.396 and have been called out on strikes 1,053 times, while being walked on 423 occasions.
As a team, the Cleveland Guardians are notching 4.5 runs per game, which is 14th in baseball.
The Chicago White Sox are sitting with an on-base percentage of.278 in addition to a batting average of.221 on the year.
The Chicago pitching staff have allowed 751 runs over the course of the season while holding an ERA of 4.85 (682 earned runs yielded).
Chicago relievers have an inherited score rate of 34.0% of 247 inherited base runners.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians have notched a total of 3,825 putouts on the campaign, as well as 1,247 assists and 71 errors.
Their fielding percentage sits at.986 which is 7th in MLB, and have earned 115 double plays.
Boyd (46-68 record in his career) sits with a FIP of 4.79 while he has gone up against 3,838 batters in the major leagues.
Chicago has recorded 115 HRs this year as well as 428 RBIs.
Martin (3-9 career record) holds a 4.27 ERA and has surrendered 8.6 hits per 9 innings.
